授業方法:
[Online format: On-demand B type (without an assigned timetable slot)]
There are weekly readings/slideshows/videos. Links to course materials will be available on line via the course website or LUNA. Announcements will be made via the course website, LUNA, or e-mail (to kwansei.ac.jp addresses). Readings will be suggested. Practice tests may be given. Homework will be given to stimulate thinking about the concepts of the lectures. (Students will be informed of details and any changes via KGU e-mail or by messages posted at "http://www.ksc.kwansei.ac.jp/~jed/MultilingMulticult/index.html".)

第1回: Aural geography: languages in the world and multilingualism (世界の言語)

Due to the coronavirus pandemic disruptions, instruction will be on line. In lieu of live lectures, material will be delivered via the internet, possibly as downloadable readings/slideshows/videos. Details will be provided by KGU e-mail or at "http://www.ksc.kwansei.ac.jp/~jed/MultilingMulticult/index.html".
第2回: Language and cultural identity (言語とアイデンティティ)
第3回: Multilingualism, bilingualism, and diglossia（多言語状況 とバイリンガリズムとダイグロッシア）
第4回: Language ecology (言語のエコロジー)
第5回: Multilingualism in Japan (日本社会の多言語・多文化状況)
第6回: The Ainu and their language (アイヌモシルの言語状況)
第7回: Language rights and policies: general issues and descriptive terms (言語権と言語政策)
第8回: The language situation of Taiwan（台湾の言語状況）
第9回: The colonization of Ogasawara (小笠原の植民地化)
第10回: The language situation of Guatemala (グアテマラの言語状況)
第11回: The language situation of Belize（ベリーズの言語状況）
第12回: Language situation in Europe (ヨーロッパの言語状況)
第13回: Language situations in the USA, Canada, Australia (他の言語状況)
第14回: Details of the exam will posted at "http://www.ksc.kwansei.ac.jp/~jed/MultilingMulticult/index.html"
